div.pre: 801 Greece, northern?, before 1966 Burial: c. 310-300 B.C. (T) Contents: c. 350 AV. Probably a hoard Philip II: 19 lifetime and post. st. (Mace- donia 11, Lampsacus 3, Abydus 1, Teos? 1, Colophon 1, Magnesia 2) Alexander III: 81 lifetime and early post. st., incl. some Philip III (Macedonia 16, Lampsacus 9, Abydus 9, Teos? 2, Miletus 3, Magnesia 1, Sardes 5, Phaselis 1, Byblus 1, Aradus 1, Ace 2, Babylon 27, Alexandria 2, unc. 2) Disposition: dispersed Record of 100 varieties on file in ANS and Paris. A lot of c. 75 Philips and Alexanders seen in Greece by a European correspondent in the late 1960's may be part of this hd. Photos of 8 pieces on file in the ANS add Tarsus to the mints of Alexander listed above
